description:
File not found /share/toggldesktop/cacert.pem

It seems something is wrong installing from the ubuntu store in ubuntu 19.04, as well as the installer on te webpage, does not install a thing.
not working on ubuntu 19
not working xubuntu 18.04
The app seems great, but does not work on current Ubuntu version.

I've been using Toggl Desktop for Mac OS X and Windows 10 for a few years. Both have more features, are more stable and look more polished than this Linux version. The Linux version looks dated, is not HIDPI compatible (tiny text), does not have advanced features such as reminder tracking based on active window title and it has a bunch of little UI quirks and bugs that make it overall feel a bit flimsy and unenjoyable to use. Worst of all, and that's the main reason why I ultimately decided to uninstall this app: it prevents KDE from shutting down or logging out gracefully due to an unfixed bug that has been reported on GitHub 4 years ago (issue #1645). It's painfully obvious that the company behind Toggl doesn't care about the Linux version. Why should I.

Same file not found error as user Riru reported. 

This is really annoying - I like toggle, and have subscribed, so I have some monetary skin in the game. 
Sure, the workaround is to run everything through the browser, but that's not the point, is it?
I'm using Toggl since 2015. It's awesome. Best way to track my time.
Works perfectly and syncs correctly, Ubuntu 20.04, Gnome
summary: Works perfectly and syncs correctly, Ubuntu 20.04, Gnome

description:
This worked on almost every distro i tried. Being flatpak that's expected. Interface is outdated, scalling doesnt work on gtk based desktops. Looks ugly.

I am using qt scaling as a environment variable as a small fix, even with that it kinda looks bad.
Thanks for the new 2020 update! Works fine on Ubuntu 20.04. I use toggl for personal and for work, glad to be able to have it on my Linux machine.
As of now the app is working,

Does tracking well. Like being able to start tracking time before I really know what I am doing. Reminders and idle detection on Linux work much better than previous versions. Colours are not very appeal and there are some screen artefacts. The web version is much more attractive but has some glitches on Firefox. Note that there is a current plan to port over to a new QT framework which should make it much more attractive and in line with what Mac users see.
I'm working remotely and the app has great feature to generate time spending per task report. Also there is an app for android and cool web version.
summary: Great app for daily work time tracking!

description: Not as many features as on Windows, but all in all, it does the job.
I installed it to avoid the web app. Well, it tracks time. But all reports and other things have to be opened in the web browser, so it renders this app useless.
Even though the web app is much richer in features, this client app makes it easy to keep track of the time
summary: Really practical and simple sync with the web client

description: The program not bad, but can be better. Add please tab Timeline, good design like in Windows. And add a simple cancel button when we edit a tracked task. OK, design can be forgiven and to do it in the last, but make, please, program better!
It works on all platforms and it's pretty easy an quick. It doesn't distract you from your tasks.
